subject: accounts in the new CMS

comments.value:
Hi,

 

Can you please confirm that the following people have user accounts for
the CMS?

 

Sutveer Kaur

Tom Farley

Dawn Bracken

Stacy Francis

Amy Holmes

Harley Cooper

 

And can you please re-instate my, Morag's, and Finn's ability to create
people ourselves?

 

Thanks,

 

Liz

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com <http://www.london2012.com> 

www.twitter.com/london2012team

subject: LOCOG internship page

comments.value:
Hi

Earlier today I created and published a page
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/locog-inte
rnship-programme.php 

 

I think the nav of that section didn't automatically republish - I've
just done that now manually. Can you investigate workflow?

 

Also, please can you make sure this link from the old site now redirects
to that page:
www.london2012.com/get-involved/work-for-2012/locog-work-sub-pages/locog
-internship-programme.php (can you do that today?!)

 

Thanks

 

deb

 

Deborah Elstein

 

Copywriter

Communications team, LOCOG

Direct line: +44 (0)20 3 2012 109

 

<hr width="100%">
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 
 
This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return
E-mail.
 
Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.
 
Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">

> Earlier today I created and published a page http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/locog-internship-programme.php
>
> I think the nav of that section didn’t automatically republish – 
> I’ve just done that now manually. Can you investigate workflow?

I'm not sure it ever did, you always had to republish the other pages 
in the section.

> Also, please can you make sure this link from the old site now 
> redirects to that page: www.london2012.com/get-involved/work-for-2012/locog-work-sub-pages/locog-internship-programme.php 
> (can you do that today?!)

Will do,

Although a certain amount of link rot has to be expected with the new 
site, we have tried our best to pattern match up all urls, news, 
blogs, pdf's etc. as well as the url for all key sections and high 
traffic pages.

But we we're never expecting to match up *every* url.

If someone wants to manually create a list of old urls -> new urls 
then we'll happily put them in the redirects file, although too many 
could slow the site down as every requested url has to be check 
against this list.

Jamie

Done..
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/work-for-2012/locog-work-sub-pages/locog-internship-programme.php

comments.value:
Hello,

 

Just back from hols this morning...so your respite from cms bug emails
from me is over ; )

 

Trying to rename an event - got error message as below

 

Could you investigate pls?

 

Thanks

 

 

 

Deborah Elstein

 

Copywriter

Communications team, LOCOG

subject: Show path in tooltip in quick search mode

comments.value: When you hover over a result in the "quick search" panel of the link picker, the page path should be displayed in a tooltip so you can disambiguate similarly named pages.

description: When you hover over a result in the "quick search" panel of the link picker, the page path should be displayed in a tooltip so you can disambiguate similarly named pages.

Janos has already fixed this on dev. Will go live in the next deployment.

thanks

subject: Re: Renaming tags containing "&" (was: searching for tags isn't w...

comments.value:
Sorry, Kieran, I didn't get your email.

 

Now I'm all confused - it's not impossible that I did HFCs rather than
the full word. But I definitely did do H&S ... I know there have been
problems with the & sign, but if I recall there were other combos of
Health and Safety that I merged into one. Do the logs reflect that?

 

________________________________

From: Deborah Elstein 
Sent: 22 October 2009 16:50
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: FW: [PostCMS support] Re: Renaming tags containing "&" (was:
searching for tags isn't w...

 

 

 

________________________________

From: Kieran Topping [mailto: ] 
Sent: 22 October 2009 16:44
To: Deborah Elstein
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Renaming tags containing "&" (was:
searching for tags isn't w...

As far as I can gather, you attempted to rename:
 Health and Safety Standard -> Health and safety (succeeded)
 H&S -> Health and safety (failed)
These are the only "rename tag" requests from you relating to health and safety yesterday. Do you recall making others?
Thanks. Kieran.

I don't recall. I thought there were a few more, but I simply couldn't
be sure. But I'll make more careful notes going forward, so I'll be more
informed if it happens again!

 

________________________________

From: Kieran Topping [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 22 October 2009 17:42
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Re: Renaming tags containing "&" (was:
searching for tags isn...

Ok. Thanks.
Incidentally a fix for the problem regarding tags containing "&" will be in the next code deployment, which we currently have scheduled for sunday evening.
Kieran

Simon

resolved?

subject: automatically finding where you want to save something

comments.value:
It used to be that when I went to folders/news articles/2009-10 when I
clicked '+' to create a new article it would detect the folder I wanted
to be in. there was a problem recently when stories got lost, but now
it's not detecting where I am anymore - it asks to 'click to choose a
folder'

 

 

 

Deborah Elstein

 

Copywriter

Communications team, LOCOG

Direct line: +44 (0)20 3 2012 109

subject: Job summary text making longer

comments.value:
Hi 

On the Jobs for the ODA page can we make the job summary text longer?

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/work-for-2012/jobs-at-the-oda/index.php

Thanks

Alex

Hi Alex,

Not sure what you mean by longer, I don't think their is a limit on this..

btw. we dumping all of this code in under 4 weeks (launch of redesigned site) and are trying to put effort towards the new2012.london.com site.

Obviously glaring bugs on the current site need fixing ASAP, but we should probably be spending time developing/testing/fixing issues on the new site at this point in time. 

Jamie

Hi Alex, realise I need to talk to you re. your  list of changes to how suppliers work.

Understand that you need to get content entered into the current site in advance of the launch of the new site.

But not sure how clear this was made, but we now have two complete different sets of code, the current site and the new redesigned site and both work in slightly different ways  (made slightly worse by the moving of the launch date as we now have to parallel run/maintain both sites at a time that you have lots of activity on the current site)

Obviously we need to get things fixed on the current site if they are holding you up / things are broken, but trying to avoid a situation where we spend to much time tweaking the current site and neglect getting the new site ready to go live at the end of the month.

Reinstating the 'Olympic Stadium' suppliers now

The working on getting the rest of 1000 days tweaks out of the way

Lets catch up on Monday re. suppliers, the current interface/tools and the new tools and how we are planning to deal with migration (we will have to set a cut off point after which changes to the current CMS will no longer appear on the new site)

Jamie

description:
Hi 

On the Jobs for the ODA page can we make the job summary text longer?

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/work-for-2012/jobs-at-the-oda/index.php

Thanks

Alex

subject: Multiple error messages issued by feed

comments.value:
Hi I seem to have received the following error message via email 50 times! One of my colleagues was deleting some out of date images yesterday - could this be why? But why 50 messages? Thanks Alex undefinedSkipping image 21-Oct-2009_16_34_40/g5image00091041.jpg(1).xml no gettyId and/or 'CMS Title' field found Deleting corrupt xml file from FTP server 21-Oct-2009_16_34_40/g5image00091041.jpg(1).xml Error deleting image http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php?action=delete&path=21-Oct-2009_16 _34_40%2fg5image00091041(1).jpg from server.
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com
Hi Alex, you should stop receiving e-mails now..

Thanks.

 

Have we done something wrong though? It's good to receive an error when
something hasn't gone across so we can see why.

 

________________________________

From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 22 October 2009 09:38
To: Alexandra Brown
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Error message

This issue was caused by the Getty feed being tested on the new CMS client.
You were mistakenly on the list of people to be notified of successes/failures.
You have now been removed.

Oh ok! Thanks

 

________________________________

To: Alexandra Brown
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Error message

subject: Event Location or Region

comments.value:
Hi
I am working on adding events to the website and wanted to know which of the fields "region" or "location" is the one to complete for getting the event to appear in the "in your area" section.

Many thanks
It's region, but the redesigned site no longer has an 'in your area section' so location will be used in future - in short fill in both fields to be sure !

subject: new CMS - sport page names

comments.value:
I've just changed the name of some of the sports pages. E.g. From
'Diving' to 'Aquatics-Diving' as 'Aquatics-Diving' is how it is going to
need to appear in the navigation. I just wanted to tell you to make
sure that it wasn't going to mess up anything.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

<hr width="100%">

What are you trying to achieve?

 It may be better for us to just programatically display the name of the discipline in the title, if you start manully putting it in the name of the sport it will start to get pulled into lots of places you may not want it to appear? ie. pulldowns.

Well I've now done it - and changed lots of the image names as well so
they all pull through properly. One reason is that on the Sports
landing page we need the images to appear with all the Aquatics ones
first, so doing it this way ensures the right alphabetization. 

 

I *think* the Sports team actually wants Diving to always appear as
Aquatics-Diving. So let's leave it for now. At some point in the future
it may be a good idea to programmatically just show 'Diving' in selected
places, but for now let's keep it Aquatic-Diving.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com <http://www.london2012.com>

subject: HOLD on Sport navigation

comments.value:
Before you start a massive re-naming campaign, let me hear back from the
Sports team on this. I don't want you to go through all the CSS changes
and then have them not like one of the wordings and have to change
AGAIN. I didn't realise this wasn't something that wasn't just
superficial!

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

Can I just quadruple check the way we're having the sports appear in the
navigation and generally across the site (and therefore in any grid of
pictograms, etc). All of these things are linked and our programmers
need to have the final naming now.

Liz
